alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 8:31AM MST until January 18 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...INCREASING SNOW INTO THE AFTERNOON... .A weather system will spread increasing snow into the region today. The snow will become heavy in the Cascades, eastern third of Washington, and the Idaho Panhandle with snow rates of near an inch per hour expected. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 8 to 12 inches in the valleys and 14 to 21 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Osburn, Lookout Pass, St. Maries, Pinehurst, Mullan, Fourth Of July Pass, Kellogg, Wallace, Dobson Pass, and Fernwood. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow rates of 1 inch per hour is expected during the Wednesday evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1.
